cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 1185 MI...1910 KM WSW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP5 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Tropical Depression Fifteen-E Advisory Number 20 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP152017 800 AM PDT Sat Sep 16 2017
...DEPRESSION EXPECTED TO LINGER OVER OPEN WATERS FOR SEVERAL MORE DAYS...
SUMMARY OF 800 AM PDT...1500 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...15.8N 126.5W ABOUT 1185 MI...1910 KM WSW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...35 MPH...55 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...W OR 270 DEGREES AT 2 MPH...4 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1005 MB...29.68 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 800 AM PDT (1500 UTC), the center of Tropical Depression Fifteen-E was located near latitude 15.8 North, longitude 126.5 West. The depression is moving toward the west near 2 mph (4 km/h). A slow northward motion is expected to begin in a day or two.
Maximum sustained winds are near 35 mph (55 km/h) with higher gusts. Little change in strength is forecast during the next 48 hours.
The estimated minimum central pressure is 1005 mb (29.68 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None.
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 200 PM PDT.
$$ Forecaster Cangialosi
NNNN
